00029 /*
00030   @page PgOptions MANUAL: PgOptions (NON-OFFICIAL-RELEASE)
00031 
00032   @section PgOptionsContents Contents
00033 
00034   @section PgOptionsIntro Introduction
00035 
00036   PgOptions is the APT library for working with command line
00037   options.  With this library, a program can declare the
00038   list of options it supports along with their kind and
00039   defaults.  PgOptions will process the command line and
00040   then the program can query what was set.
00041 
00042   Like standard unix programs, an option of "--" ends option
00043   parsing.  All the remaning arguments are args to the
00044   program.
00045 
00046   There are three kinds of options: BOOL, DOUBLE and STRING.
00047   All three kinds may have a value appended to the option name with "=".
00048   (Like: "--double-example=10.5", "--output-dir=foo".)
00049 
00050   BOOL values may have a prefix of "-no-" or "--no-" to set
00051   the value to "false".  If the arg after a bool option is
00052   "true/1" or "false/0" it is used as the value.  Otherwise
00053   the option is set to true.  (Note that this might make
00054   working with a file called "true" ambiguous.  In that case
00055   use "--" to seperate the args from the option.)
00056 
00057   Non-option args to the program are put into the "args"
00058   list which the program can retreive with "getArg(idx)".
00059 
00060   @section PgOptionsExample Example
00061 
00062   Normal usage looks like:
00063 
00064 @verbatim
00065 int main (int argc,char* argv[]) {
00066 
00067   PgOptions opts;
00068   opts->setUsage("A nice paragraph about what this program does.");
00069   opts->defineOption("p","print",PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00070                      "Do you want to print the output?",
00071                      "true");
00072 
00073   opts->parseArgv(argv);
00074 
00075   if (opts->getBool("print")) {
00076     doPrint();
00077   }
00078 }
00079 @endverbatim
00080 
00081   @section PgOptionsNotes Notes
00082 
00083   * Please try and write the options in the "positive sense".
00084   If the default is to print, then define the option "print"
00085   to be true.  The user can use "--no-print" when they dont
00086   want to.  (Dont define "--no-print".)
00087 
00088  */
00089

00091 #define PGOPTIONS_H

00093 // "APT_PGOPTIONS_NO_XERCES" is used to remove the use of
00094 // Xerces XML functions in PgOptions.
00095 // affy/exact uses PgOptions, but has no need of XML.
00096 // providing an option to disable
00097

00112 class APTLIB_API PgOpt {
00113 public:
00115   typedef enum PgOptType {
00116     INVALID_OPT,
00117     BOOL_OPT,
00118     DOUBLE_OPT,
00119     INT_OPT,
00120     STRING_OPT,
00121   } PgOptType_t;
00122 
00123 public:
00124   std::string m_shortName;           
00125   std::string m_longName;            
00126   //
00127   std::string m_help;                
00128   PgOptType   m_type;                
00129   std::string m_defaultValue;

00131   int         m_allowMultiple;       
00132   //int         m_numargs;
00133 
00135   PgOpt();
00136   PgOpt(const PgOpt* orig);
00137 
00140   void allowMutipleValues(int val);
00143   bool isSet();
00146   int getValueCount() const;
00150   std::string getValue(size_t idx=0) const;
00154   bool   getValueBool(int idx=0) const;
00158   int    getValueInt(int idx=0) const;
00162   double getValueDouble(int idx=0) const;
00165   std::string getDefaultValue() const;
00166 
00168   void clearValues();
00171   void setValue(const std::string &new_value) {
00172     m_values.resize(0);
00173     pushValue(new_value);
00174   }
00178   void pushValue(const std::string& new_value);
00180   void resetToDefault();
00181 
00182   std::vector<std::string> getValueVector() const;
00183 
00187   int checkParseIsOk(const std::string& value) const;

00192 
00194   void dump() const;
00195 };

00369   void set(const std::string &name, const std::string &new_value) {
00370       if ((isOptDefined("xml-file")) && (name == "xml-file"))
00371       {
00372         if (mustFindOpt(name)->isSet()) {
00373           Err::errAbort("The xml-file option has already been set. Only one xml-file can be specified.");
00374         }
00375         std::vector<std::string> vFileNames;
00376         setOptionsFromXMLFile(new_value, vFileNames);
00377       }
00378       mustFindOpt(name)->setValue(new_value);
00379   }
00383   void push(const std::string &name, const std::string &value) {
00384     mustFindOpt(name)->pushValue(value);
00385   }
